channel.title: Domain without address?
channel.description: Are their any websites to create a .com website that doesnt need your address? I go to godaddy.com and they need your address to buy a domain.. are their any websites that don't need your address? Because I don't feel comfortable giving them that personal of information.

item.title: Domain without address?
item.dc:creator: @nohope nohope
item.description:
@nohope wrote:

[quote=“jme_009, post:10, topic:133290”][quote author=USMC link=topic=184543.msg1672533#msg1672533 date=1187056389]
register with namecheap.com, they give a free whois guard with all domains.
(protects your personal info)
[/quote]

I know this is a trusted site and all, but they scammed me mainly because of their lack of customer support. I had put something like 20 dollars into my account for domains. Then I bought one(was going to buy some more later). At the time I was sharing a paypal account with someone and he reversed the payment and tried to steal my money since I quit working on a project that we were making. Anyways so namecheap banned me and said to reverse the reversed charge to get unbanned(lol, sounds confusing). So I did, I sent them back the 20-something dollars and they never unbanned me and they won’t return emails. Paypal wouldn’t let me reverse the payment again. So I lost 20 bucks =/ Shit I went way off topic lol.[/quote]That is confusing lolo , I’m just sticking with godaddy.com

Read full topic

item.title: Domain without address?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“USMC, post:6, topic:133290”]register with namecheap.com, they give a free whois guard with all domains.
(protects your personal info)[/quote]

I know this is a trusted site and all, but they scammed me mainly because of their lack of customer support. I had put something like 20 dollars into my account for domains. Then I bought one(was going to buy some more later). At the time I was sharing a paypal account with someone and he reversed the payment and tried to steal my money since I quit working on a project that we were making. Anyways so namecheap banned me and said to reverse the reversed charge to get unbanned(lol, sounds confusing). So I did, I sent them back the 20-something dollars and they never unbanned me and they won’t return emails. Paypal wouldn’t let me reverse the payment again. So I lost 20 bucks =/ Shit I went way off topic lol.

Read full topic

the site says $8.88 and less lol.

item.title: Domain without address?
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

nohope:

Im paying by cash , Ok . I’ll just give my address. Thanks anyways.

Don’t worry, if you’re paying then they shouldn’t give out your details to anyone. The most that will happen is you will get some spam via snail mail, but I doubt it because the majority of spam now days is electronic. and you’re welcome.

Read full topic

item.title: Domain without address?
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

leader:

If you are paying by paypal, you need to put your credit card details.

If you’re paying by paypal they can contact them for your address

Read full topic

item.title: Domain without address?
item.dc:creator: @leader leader
item.description:
@leader wrote:

therealjdb:

Well, if you’re buying a domain they need billing information and shouldn’t give the details out to anyone else. Also I believe in order to register a domain name they need your address for public records(whois).

Yes, the address is for whois.

nohope:

Are their any websites to create a .com website that doesnt need your address? I go to godaddy.com and they need your address to buy a domain… are their any websites that don’t need your address? Because I don’t feel comfortable giving them that personal of information.

If you are paying by credit card, you need to put your address.
If you are paying by paypal, you need to put your credit card details.

Read full topic
